comment: Great class if you don't want to learn anything

Online class was pretty easy. I read the book on  occasion, but most of the test questions can be found if you just copy & paste it into Google. Really nice professor! Essay over a book, but I never even bought the book and made a 94 on the essay. Highly recommend!
Professor Crawford is extremely helpful. However, she is a hard teacher and she expects a lot. This class was all writing and reading. But it is a upper-level course so it has to be hard.

She is very passionate about Theory and taught it well for an online-class. However, like the others said, there are 3 test consisting of 5 to 6 essays, and a portfolio of 15 to 20 pages. This is an intense reading and writing class. I would not take this with another junior/senior class but rather a general ed course. A lot work!

The Online class has a lot of busy work that is very time consuming. The readings are very intensive. Test were essay exams however, if you answer all of the essay questions at the end of the chapter or DQ, you will have your exam done. She picks questions from the end of the chap. Expectations are clear & gives helpful hints. Do the work get an A.

I took her online & she seems like she is a nice lady. Her work load is worse than my other four classes combined. Her test are all essay exams and there is one big project that has 6 mini essays due. The word mini does not mean easy because they are not as easy as you would think. If I could redo I would not have taken her.

To give her credit she does know what she is talking about. On the other hand her lectures dont match up with her tests. She gives a confusing and difficult project that is 35% of your grade. If your not really interested in sociology then shes not for you. She is real nice but she isnt easy.

The class itself was a little difficult but overall I made a B. The class was fun and the only graded things are the tests and final paper. If you can handle large classes and doing a lot of studying then take this class. The professor does give great notes.

Class consisted of trying to take 3 pages of notes while listening to her talk non-stop gibberish. Grade comes from two really hard tests, end of course paper, and final so if you mess up on one, you're screwed.

She makes powerpoints for every class and lectures about them the enitre time but you can't even listen because you are too busy writing and the notes are not online. There are 2 hard online tests, a 6-10 page paper, and an in class final. The requirements for the paper and not clear, but the final basically comes from the 2 online tests.
I personally did not care for this professor. At first she seems really cool and approachable, but in reality she's condescending and judgemental.

Not helpful with any question you have. When she answers questions you have they are very vague, not helpful and she will say it in a way that makes you feel stupid. Really needs to work on her people skills and to learn helping students is her job, not making them feel bad about themselves.

Syllabus said your attendance would decide in what grade you got if you were borderline, so i attended every class just to find out at the end of the semester that she does not follow her syllabus. I had an 89.6, my friend had an 89.8 and we both attended every single class and she gave us a B in the class. She was also very rude

Attendance not mandatory. Boring lectures. Few grades, no room for error. I thought she was awesome, but 100% of your grade is decided in the last week and a half of the course. Group project was sub-par and very demanding. The final was 2 parts: essay and multiple choice administered via PowerPoint. Totally unfair. Made an 89 and angry.

Worst teacher ever, only grade is your final so if you are not a strong test taker I recommend a different teacher. Lectures are very boring, never clear on what she wants, attendance is mandatory. I studied for 3 days and still made a C. your final consists of an essay too and its very unclear and she will not help you with it. TERRIBLE!

Saves 90% of your grade till the last week. Lectures are boring! She is rude to students and her class is rediculous. 2 writing assignments, a huge group project, and a final exam all in the same week. TERRIBLE!

Very easy throughout the semester... UNTIL the final exam. She gives no tests or grades until the last week, when 2 papers, a huge group project, and the exam are due. The project isn't so bad, nor are the papers, but the exam itself is intense. It is very specific on dates and names, none of which she goes over in class. Nice, but doesn't teach

Attendance taken. Group Project. Can't get a clean answer from her, to her all questions seem to be too 'vague.' had a class of 200, heard her class of 20 is just the same. Quizzes over text, which seem to be made harder than they really are. Don't see why she is getting such high ratings.

She takes attendance, but its not mandatory. I skipped this class all the time and got a B. It's pretty pointless, but harmless. If you HATE group work like I do, don't take her. We didn't have exams until the final, just optional practice tests. Final was multiple choice with take home essay assignment. This class was so easy to BS my way through.

This class is heavy on group work.  Get yourself in a good group if you take this class.  There was one test and it was the final worth 40% of your grade, however she took it from the practice tests she had posted online for months.  I liked the class but would recommend taking the 3 credit Sociology class instead.

This class is useless, Ms. Crawford can not handle a class of 20 let along a class of over 200. She incorrectly recorded a grade. I emailed her twice and she did not fix it. The debates were fun, though. That is something positive about the class. Not responding to a student's complaint is totally unprofessional. I advise students to take psych.

Great teacher, gets along with students well. Group project in this class due at the end of the semester. Her final is multiple choice. Online quizzes come straight from thr book.If u read your book, can get an easy A and do your project because it is peer graded

You work in groups the whole semester. No test until the exam and a final project. Several opportunities for extra credit. If your looking to actually learn this isnt the class you have to learn by the book by your self. But pretty easy A if you have a good group.

Do not take this class. The entire class is group based except the final. This is horrible since their are over 250 students in your class and you are randomly assigned a group. It will end that a one person does all the work. and you can easily fail the class because they are such few grades. i did well thats because i did all the work in my group

Be prepared to teach yourself. The most useless class Ive ever taken. I know we are college students and the workload is challenging, but she gave more work then my other 4 classes combined. And dont be fooled by "take home" tests. They are ridiculous. She is the reason I changed my major. Come on people, being nice doesnt make her a great teacher!
STAY AWAY. this class was useless. take any other class in this section besides sociology.

This class is solely dependant on the effort you and your group put into the class. The tests are at home and online. READ the chapters and highlight as you go through. Before you go to the final which is closed book and in class, review all of your tests, you'll make an A. Try to find a book with yellow, pink, green and blue highlights. *HINT*

Great professor. Reading textbook is a must, there is a very lengthy group assignment that she requests that is really annoying and somewhat demanding. She also test after every chapter(which are taught through PP) and gives little sociology experiments that if you post your feelings about them you can get extra points. Easy to make an A.

if you pick this class make sure you group up with hard working people, not with attitudes because you will be stuck with them the rest of the semester in creating a society. all test online so you can use your book but still seem redundant. i did not like the class because of the group project.

Nice teacher. Entire class seems to be based on one project, the "create a society" project. make sure to pick a group that works hard! If you pick slackers, you will be sorry. Every week there is a new wks to fill out and post. tests are online and lecture days are on PP every Monday and are directly from the text. READ and attend lecture days!

Very laid-back, relaxed style of teaching. We always arranged the desks in a circle to facilitate class discussion. Found it hard as I am shy and she wanted every class for us to talk/discuss readings/news. Asked us to read long chapters in our theory books. Tests were essays but she gave us a week to write them and she graded fair.

GREAT TEACHER! LOVED Prof. Crawford's class. Weekly quizzes that are taken from textbook readings. Group project (lots of work). Please make sure you participate in this project YOU will be glad you did. Do the desocialization exercises...they are worth extra credit and VERY interesting!! Lastly, PARTICIPATE in the homelessness awareness week!!!

Cool, fun teacher. Makes the class interesting. Quizzes are all online and so easy if you read the chapter. However, she assigns a group project she calls "Creating a Society." This assignment kept me from having an A, other than that I would highly recommend her for this class.

Easy class, just read the book and pay attention to the lectures.  Take notes from power points. Sometimes had guest speakers for extra credit. If you do the desocialization exercises, you'll can get 5 points extra credit. The final are questions from the online quizzes taken throughout the semester.

Few discussions here and there, but mostly powerpoint presentations (which are not posted online, so pay attention!) Tests are online, and not extremely difficult. Prof. Crawford is extremely helpful-even welcomes you to come to her office after. She monitored attendence at first, but stopped toward the end of the semester.Overall a great professor

This was an extremely easy class, and having Professor Crawford only made it easier.  Online quizzes over selected chapters in the book are every week, and there's a pretty time consuming group project that goes throughout the semester.  Since it's a required course, I would highly recommend taking Professor Crawford's sociology class.

Hands down my favorite professor!!!! I just took the class because I had to, but it ended up being my favorite class! She was hillarious and was so entertaining! I learned so much from the class!!! I definitely reccomend it!!!

Lots of positive energy from the teacher, but still professional. Online quizzes about once a week. The lectures aren't necessary, just read (the book is quite interesting) and you'll be fine. The final comes straight from the quizzes. There's an ongoing group project that's a ton of work, but you learn a lot. Interesting extra credit too!

She is the best professor I have ever had at KSU! I'm surprised at all the negative comments because she is such an amazing teacher. Attendance is mandatory, but her class was fun- she made you think! People complain about that, but that's what school is for. If I could I would take her every semester.

stay away!!! alot of discussion and only 1 open book test - have no idea where the questions came from. grade is made up of discussion, essay and 1 open book test that counts for 40% of grade. took class during summer. not hard just alot of work. great teacher but dont recommend her class.

Difficult class b/c she does not understand or teach her subject matter well.You read massive amounts of material then tests on very specific details,not concept. Talks endlessly about how she's excited about sociology but never really teaches you anything. Was looking forward to this class but was a huge disappointment.
Great Teacher, and really makes you think and evaluate your thoughts
class was boring and all tests are on vista which is annoying because vista goes down a lot. other than that pretty decent, was just there and really didn't retain anything.

I would walk in, sign in and leave. Actually attended class twice, once on the first day, once on the day we presented our projects. The online tests are a pain in the ass. Nice lady, not a effective teacher. Easy A however.
Awesome professor. One of the classes I looked forawrd to the days I attended class. She was a really sweet professor, gave extra credit, and was extremely kind. I recommend her.

Easy A! She teaches straight from the book. A lot of small exercises and a few group projects. Online tests. Get a good group or your time in class will SUCK. Format for papers is in her syllabus - follow it exactly or you will get a zero. Do exercises and projects and it will be a breeze!

Prof Crawford is really straight forward in what she expects on projects. Attendance is not manadatory however, she does make you sign in each class period. I think this is to help out students that are points aways from a good or better grade. I would definitely take if you need to boost your GPA or if you are on the verge of academic dismissal.

Easy A. Horrible class. Crawford really cares about sociology but doesn't have a great teaching style. Attendance is mandatory, she teaches straight from power points, and there are random group projects that are very time consuming. If you need an A, take this class but that's the only reason I would recommend it.
Prof Crawf was a pretty easy teacher. If you want an easy A for your Gen Ed requirement, take this class. Online tests and a lot of group assignments. I recommend it for GPA purposes.
my class had 250 students so it was actually pretty easy if you did the work. tests were online. she does take role every class and its hard to get help since the class was so big.
I had her for Social theory and the work was horrible.  Was her first year teaching it participation was 25% of grade and was kept track by tally marks.  Take Benjamin instead.  Avoid at all cost.

Crawford is the hardest teacher I have ever had. I do not think I have ever done so much work in one semester in my entire life. The teacher is very kind and smart but presents the methods in a confusing way.  You have 2 huge papers.

Mrs. Crawford is a very nice lady. Be ready to work your butt off!! You have project after project as well as weekly reading summaries. If you want an easy A this is NOT for you, this class takes A LOT of HARD work. The final is take home in essay format, you may think take home will be easy but it is really not, you have to apply a lot of thought!
She is a very tough teacher. She piles on work to the max. She is also not clear with her assignments-she expects you to 'figure it out on your own'. I wish I had looked into other teachers...
SHE IS A DYNAMIC! IN FACT THE BEST THAT I HAVE TAKEN AT KSU! THE ONLY BAD THING IS SHE TAKES ATTENDANCE DAILY AS A GRADE. OTHER THAN THAT TESTS ARE ONLINE. I LOVED THIS CLASS!!

I totally love this teacher! She's great at her job and genuinely wants her students to succeed. She takes attendance, which sucks, but it's a really fun class. We got to do our midterm in groups, which I thought was awesome. She's a great teacher! Take her if you can!

Crawford is a really nice lady. Shes really excited about Sociology. Attendance is a must. The tests are online and are straight from the book. If you take the time and read the assigned chapters you will do fine. However it's not an easy A. (you have to read GOOD to do well on tests) I made a B in the class but didn't put much effort into it.
Really enthusiastic and helpful. The tests are online which make the class a lot easier. There is a lot of group work, but she gives you plenty of time to work on everything.

Awesome Professor! Very friendly and willing to help. Tests strait out of the book. Tests are WebCT and you have plenty of time to choose when to take them. Media Project kinda sucks. But if you work on it early its not bad. Lost of Busy work but VERY easy. Come to class and you will do fine.

She is a good teacher, LOVES debates. As long as you go to class sign your name then you will be fine, read the chapters yourself and take notes and you will ace the test. Take them in groups and you wont have anything to worry about in the class

She is an awesome teacher.  She loves teaching and loves her students.  She wants you to get the best out of her class and will do whatever it takes.  It is a lot of discussion but everyone feels comfortable to talk.  I never learned as much in any class as I did in this one.  Highly reccommend you take her!!

Enjoyed this class as well as the professor.  Required A Lot of work, but it was worth it and truely walked away with a knowledge that can be applied to every aspect of your life.  Professor Crawford enjoys her job and the material she teaches which makes the entire experience worth every moment.

Get ready to work hard!!! There is so much work in this class! She is a really nice lady & really respectful, but I would only recommend this class to anyone who is interested in Sociology. I think she graded everything pretty tough and expected a lot out of us. I learned a lot from the class though! Huge project!!!

Awesome professor! She's very friendly and you can tell she enjoys teaching the class. Class is fun because it's mostly discussion and she doesn't just lecture the whole time. She answers questions and accepts everyones opinions. She's passionate about the subject and made it interesting.. not to mention it was SO easy! I definitely recommend her!

Professor Crawford was wonderful. Passionate about sociology, and LOVES her students! She was caring and nice. Tests are a little difficult, but if you study you'll be fine. Classes are fun and interesting, one of my favorite professors ever.

great teacher. clear. is passionate about subject & doesn't have any apparent bias. uses many tools, like videos, online articles, & the books. holds many class discussions & keeps lectures interesting. only complain is that as soon as one assignment was done another would be assigned not including weekly homework. my favorite class this semester
No Comments
